reviewText:
I chose this style (Titanium 2 -- One of A Kind * G-Dragon, set of two rings) because I thought it would be a tasteful ring that wouldn't be gaudy or overly obvious. It's exactly what I expected; the ring is a nice size such that it's appropriate for a variety of situations and can be worn as a general ring accessory as opposed to just as a blatant advertisement to the world that you're a G-Dragon fan.

The rings are of very nice quality and have a comfortable weight to them. The jewel is set well, and the metal doesn't scratch easily. I was worried that it might be plated or would rust/tint/tarnish/otherwise change, but it's remained exactly as it looked when I first received the package. The text is not just printed on the ring; rather, it's carved into the metal and then inked black. Therefore, even if the ink is removed, the carved text still remains. There were a few tiny spots where the ink seemed to be inconsistent (most of it was black, but there were a few tiny spots where the ink seemed to have faded a little bit) but it's not noticeable unless under very close examination.

The only downside is that the inside of the ring is very smooth and polished, so if it's not a very snug fit on your finger, it's very easy to have it slip off of your finger. I lost one two days after wearing it (from my first order) and ordered a second pair so I could have some extra in case I lost another one.

As a side note about the seller -- the shipping was much faster than estimated (came about a month earlier than expected). For my first order, everything was fine: I got two rings in a plastic slip, as well as two short black bands for the necklace. No extra gifts/cards/etc., but it was well packed. The second order came with only one ring, but with a different black band/rope for the necklace, as well as a plastic "jewel" ring case. I contacted the seller about the missing second ring from this order, and within a few hours I received a lovely email with profuse apologies and a promise that they would ship the second ring ASAP. About a week later (super fast shipping, seeing how it's coming from China!), I received the second ring along with another black band for the necklace and a plastic "jewel" ring case. The customer service was absolutely wonderful, and I really appreciate their effort in making up for the accidental oversight the first time.

In conjunction with the excellent quality of the ring and the refreshingly positive customer service experience I had with the seller, I would not hesitate to order from them again (either this exact order, or another product).
summary: High Quality Product & Wonderful Customer Service

I was excited to get this bra in the mail, hoping to wear shirts and dresses coincidently. The bra was too small and broke within a few hours of wearing it. I like how it looked and felt, I think I might try the next size up but seeing how the last bra broke I'm a little skeptical.

I wore this to a wedding and it fit just fine. I liked that it wasn't thick but thick enough that when it got chilly it wouldn't be noticeable. This is a good strapless/backless option if you're just looking for coverage. The center of bra snaps together so if you need to have it detached for whatever reason you can. It's also very sticky so no fears of it just falling off.

I have bought many strapless/backless adhesive bras from amazon and most of them were good, but this particular bra was terrible. First, when I unpacked it to try it on, I found that the part that was supposed to be sticky on the bra was not very sticky at all. Second, after I stuck it on, it pulled my breasts down and made them sag instead of pushing them up and together. My boobs are naturally somewhat perky and don't usually sag, so it was alarming to see this bra make them look that way. I know that I shouldn't expect it to act like a real pushup bra because I'm aware that backless/strapless bras are no match for gravity. But these literally pulled my breasts downward. I tried taking them off and reapplying them in multiple angles and areas, but no luck. My boobs are also rather wide set so this bra didn't do a good job of pushing them together. But I would say this bra MIGHT be okay for you if your boobs are naturally extremely perky and centered (in which i feel like you wouldn't even need this unless you're just looking for nipple coverage).
summary: No Lift or Cleavage, Made My Non-Saggy Breasts Look Like They Were Sagging

reviewText:
First of all, let me say that after reading most of the reviews here, I see that many didn't understand that when buying a corset, you are not basing the size on your actual waist measurement.  When measuring for a corset, you want to buy one that is actually 4-7 inches smaller than your natural waistline (7-10 if you're plus sized).  You don't want the corset lacing to meet flush in the back when you first put it on, you want to be able to pull the corset strings in order to tighten it around your torso in order to get a snug, but not constrictive, fit.  This is the way a corset is supposed to work. If you buy one the exact size of your waist, the laces will meet completely in the back, but you will not get the effect you want, and it may even seem too big.  You actually do want it to be a little "too small".  It will also stretch some as it breaks in, so you also want to allow for that, just like you would jeans or shoes.

Since I am large busted, I was concerned I might not have enough room up top, and also did not want to feel too constricted since this is for a costume I will be wearing all day.  Breaking it in, I found that it does indeed accommodate my bust (47 in) but is actually a little too loose on my waist (39 in), but I'm thinking with help, I could probably get the lacing tighter.  I really should have gone down a size (4X) with this particular corset, since it has top front lacing that can be adjusted to fit.  The ribbing is steel (magnet tested), and overall it's well constructed, although not very rigid. It will work great for my costume!  I will probably buy another in the future.

Edited 9/19/2015:  I have discovered breaking it in that the cup area is not as supportive as I would have liked it to be.  Even tightened, it has a tendency to roll down if you bend over some.  Cinching it tighter just makes it look weird. Not as great as I hoped, but not bad if you're not overly busty.

Keep in mind I have changed my eating habits as well. This I use for a strong core when it comes to lifting as well. This is a good starter one and been loving these results.

However it is possible that the spiral steel used may be lower quality and there fore flimsy. But no matter how flimsy, the steel spriral with still how up MUCH better than plastic, which with bend and cause "indents" where the plastic bone snapped , especially if your tight lacing, it would likely become snapped the first time u lace it up using tight lacing. Moral of the story...
DO A BETTER JOB RESEARCH HOW TO WAIST TRAIN PROPERLY AND WHAT TO LOOK FOR IN A CORSET WHEN U WANNA START WAIST TRAINING! GET EDUCATED!!

Unfortunately, I can't afford to buy another one from somewhere else and don't trust the shipping time. The only reason this is getting 2 stars instead of 1 is that it arrived a week or two before the 'estimated delivery date' (and thank goodness for that too, because that would have been after I needed it.) What a disappointment. I ordered according to natural waist size, and even with the laces completely closed, does not give me an hourglass shape. When the laces between the breasts are pulled together, it creates a weird bump. I did not think this would be an issue as I am somewhat top heavy. The steel boning is a joke if you are expecting ridgidness. This in no way could be used for waist training.  Being somewhat of a corset fanatic, I would have to say this is by far the cheapest looking corset I have ever bought...it does exactly the opposite of what it should do to a woman's body. Not even worth the seemingly reasonable cost of the item. I wish I hadn't wasted my money.
This will be perfect for my Steampunk Pirate costume. It does run snug; so, order a size or two up as was suggested.

I've ordered a few inexpensive corsets lately, so that I can cycle through a few for a bit of back support.  Since these are cheap I am mostly planning to add additional boning, and reinforce the material if necessary.

This is absolutely the nicest of the group.  I won't try to suggest that it's anything but an inexpensive corset--but it's a very, very nice inexpensive corset.  I bought it because I think the design is adorable, and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality.
* I selected a size that is about 3"-5" less than my natural waist measurement, and it fits properly.  Wearing it just tight enough to stay on, the gap is about the width of the modesty panel.  There's lots of room to tighten it further.
* The fabric material is quite solid, a nice firm brocade exterior and a durable-feeling nonstretch lining.
* The design allows for my busty boobs to stay in the proper place, rather than sliding up or down.  I'm just "breaking it in" so far--not tightening it much yet--and even so I am not having to shift it to keep it in place.  Most corsets need the boning to "learn" to bend to go around a bust (especially a large one).
* I have a long torso along with the substantial bust, and the length of this corset is enough to sit at my hips and provide the low back support that I need.
* The bones are in fact metal; I tested with a magnet.  It's narrow and very flexible metal, but it's metal.

I've found that, with the inexpensive corsets I've been picking up, the corsets with narrow, flexible metal bones are a little stronger overall than the ones with narrow flexible plastic bones.  The metal bones are less likely to buckle outwards unpleasantly, kinking into permanent "love handles."  The narrow bones obviously don't provide as much support as wider spiral steel bones or doubled metal bones, and they don't provide support like flat steel bones do.  But they are more likely to keep the corset shaped the way I want it to be shaped, instead of buckling under pressure and creating a permanent set of love handles in the curves of the boning.

With all of these inexpensive corsets, both metal and plastic bones, I am breaking them in gently.
* For the first few days, I wear it just tight enough to stay on and in place.  The bones "learn" the shape of a body, develop the right kind of bends.
* With some corsets I put an elastic back brace around my waist to help the bones develop the right curve.
* Then gradually tighten it a bit more each day.  This should help prevent the corset from buckling and making boned love handles.
* When I am able to fully tighten it, it should give me independent support for my boobs and my problematic low back.  Bonus, it should emphasize my waist.  That's not the goal, but it's a nice side effect.

But of course weak material or weak bones won't be able to withstand tightening, no matter how gently it's broken in,

I may go ahead and add some more boning to this corset, next to the existing bones.  I don't think it will need any reinforcement of the material; the material is strong.  If I start to tighten it and determine that it needs more boning [for my purposes], I'll return and add to my review.
summary: Better than I expected, certainly good value

reviewText: Great to replace leather wallet in the Caribbean. Does not mold or get Funky!
Quality made wallet

I've been using the wallet for a few weeks now and by all appearances, it is living up to its billing.  By now, the stainless steel wallets I had been using were already showing signs of their eventual failure.  This wallet looks exactly the same as the day I got it.  So far, so good.  AND it's made in America!

I don't remember where I first heard of RaggedEdge Gear, but after going through a new wallet about every six months for five years due to wear and tear, it seemed like a great idea.

I was EXTREMELY impressed by the specs of the wallet on paper, and more impressed when it arrived, but I've received many a pretty wallet that began to show wear after only a couple days, so I decided to wait on my review until I'd put the wallet through some normal day-to-day "abuse".

My previous wallet was a stainless steel bi-fold, with the "fold" that's fabric instead of steel (as I learned from a previous steel wallet that the fold will eventually begin to shred, tear and look otherwise ragged). While it lasted for a bit over a year, it began to get "mini-dents", scratches, etc, within only a couple weeks.  I have now had my RaggedEdge for over two months, and I am hard-pressed to find ANY signs of wear.  The plastic over the ID window STILL grabs my drivers license when I try to remove it, and my cards still have just a little bit of tacky stickiness in their slots. The wallet MAY fold slightly more easily now than at first, but it's honestly hard to tell.  Best of all, NONE of the surfaces, external or internal, show ANY wear, and even maintain a nice shine just like the first day.

I can't say much for the effectiveness of the RF blocking, as I don't have any handy tests to run, but that function was really more of a bonus for me than a necessity. As far as the necessity, however, I'd highly recommend this wallet to anyone looking for something close to "bulletproof"-- at least, as far as the normal life & wear/tear on a wallet goes.

I've gradually been moving towards a super-thin wallet for quite some time now. I don't like the feel of sitting on a thick wallet, and don't much care for the bulge it adds in your pocket. After the "Leather LA" wallet from CountyComm ripped, I found this one after much searching, and it's pretty much everything I wanted. It's very very thin, seems to be pretty durable, and has a clear ID window. I carry my license, my carry permit, my insurance card, and three credit cards. It holds it all very securely, and I don't have to fumble to show my ID. I don't often carry cash, but when I do there is enough room to do so if I fold it twice lengthwise, and only carry 5 or 6 bills. I could probably carry more, but it starts getting a little bulky and I don't want to stretch this thing out.

So yeah, so far so good! I'm really enjoying having this, and haven't yet found anything I don't like about it.

reviewText:
I've had a Koyono Slimmy (leather) for the last decade-plus, and enjoy small "front pocket" wallets. As the Slimmy has started showing its age (fraying and stitches breaking) I looked around to see what was "new" in the minimal/slim wallet scene.

This wallet is even smaller than Slimmy. It's very well-built with high-quality stitching. I've used it daily for a couple weeks now, and it has started to "break in", making it a little easier to jam cards in and take them out. I really like the ID window as I need to show an ID pretty regularly, and don't have to fish it out anymore.

If you want a minimalist wallet, but haven't had one before, the Koyono Slimmy is a great first step: you can put more stuff in it. If you've been around the block with others and are ready to really downsize, this is a great next step.

For reference, a "broke in" Slimmy can fit 4-6 Credit Cards + 4-6 "Flat" cards + 20-25 bills folded in half. A "broke in" Ragged Edge minimalist can fit 2 Credit Cards + 2-3 "Flat" cards + 12-15 bills folded in quarters, or 15-20 folded in thirds.

I have finally found the perfect bag (after years of searching and purchasing Coach, Michael Kors, Kate Spade, Vera Bradley, Fossil, etc.,).  All of those other brands are "fine," but the Dooney Small Lexington is absolute perfection!  The size is perfect (not too big...not too small), the leather is delicious, and the color selection is second to none.  I love that it is kind of like a tote bag and stands on its own without tipping over.  Also, the little key holder inside is a cool feature--I can't imagine how much time I am going to gain in life without having to search for my car/house keys again!  I just received the Small Lexington in Dark Grey and turned right around and ordered another in Sage.  ILoveDooney is great--I received my Dark Grey bag in less time than they estimated and it was packaged very nicely. Plus, their prices are awesome!  I love this bag SO much that I cleaned out my closet and gave away all of my other bags!  I hope that Dooney and Bourke never stops making this style as I will purchase the Small Lexington over and over again.  I will never purchase another kind of bag.  Bliss....

reviewText: Hi,first of all let me say this is my first Dooney & Bourke purse and I absolutely love it!  I searched long & hard for a purse that won't slip off my shoulders and is not too big. It also comes with a key holder strap that makes it easy to locate your car keys.  It has lots of roomy pockets for cell phone on the inside and outside, and comes in a variety of colors.  I think choosing a color was the hardest part, ha!  It was shipped in perfect condition and has all the original packing.  Also came with a fabric storage bag to store your purse when you are not using it, this was an extra plus.  I am very happy that I ordered this purse.  Thank you!

The item came very nicely packaged with all labels, a dust cover, and lovely new leather smell. I thought this bag might not fit everything I usually carry, but surprisingly it fits everything I need and its better organized than my old tote.  I can find things easier, and the leather trims on the inside pockets prevent them from sagging. The bag runs a little too heavy for me when full, so I will not be buying a larger pebble shopper, but I would definitely buy another color in this design. I recommend this item to anyone who has been considering buying one.

It also comes with a belt, but I sold mine to platos closet. I use another waist belt that looks super cute. Pair it with a cropped denim jacket and bright sandals? Awesome.

It's cheap and cheaply made.  One of the snaps on the belt was missing so I'll have to replace the snap to wear the belt.  The under-slip is about knee length and ruins the look of the chiffon.  There is no waist, just a straight A-line so the fabric of the dress has to be adjusted under the belt to smooth and prevent bunching.  Finally, the hem is machined and looks jagged as if it had been zigzagged, not a real hem rolled or otherwise.  All this is unfortunate, as the dress looks simply lovely in the photograph.

For size I'm 5'8" and about 190 pounds, size 12/14. The bottoms fit great, the top however has a large space between the breasts. I had to stitch it closer together so I could fill the cups, someone bustier would probably be fine.
summary: The bottoms fit great, the top however has a large space between ...

reviewText: To huge

I am 5'7 168lbs and wear a 32g bra. My waist is 30 inches and hips 42 inches. I bought an xxxl and it fits pretty good. The waist was a bit big, but it shouldn't be an issue. The top is a bit wide in the cleavage, but I am going to alter it. I really like the suit,  I don't see it lasting years, but I think it will last at least 2 summers. I have a flabby lower belly from pregnancy and this swim suit hides it well. I would definitely recommend this swim suit.
The material is okay! The size run small, my size is large + My bra size is big, and i had to order the xxxl, and fits perfect!

reviewText: I bought a 3xl. However, I was sent a 2xl... but, it actually fit so I cannot complain. The top is kind of small, my girls try popping out the front but it will work. I'm about 5'1" and 180lbs... I'm fairly large in the stomach area, and the behind. It definitely camouflages my problem area (stomach) very well. And the leg holes are comfy on my larger thighs. I finally found a swim suit that makes me feel sexy! It's a great fabric, and seems to be made pretty well! I recommend this swimsuit.

I love this suit!  I thought it was super cute online.  I usually never shop online for clothing because I'm 5'1 and about 215 pounds.  I ordered the XXXL and it fits great.  I feel like someone who is anymore than 10-15 pounds more than me probably wouldn't fit in the bottoms though.  I wear a 38 C bra size and the cups on the swimming suit fit fine.  The space between the cups is pretty big, but I didn't feel like I couldn't wear it in public the way it is.  The quality of it feels nice, and I'm really looking forward to wearing this to the pool and the cabin this summer!
Fit very well and very flattering.  Super cute, especially for the price!  Gonna look stylin on the beach this summer!

I looked at the size chart and got the 4xl I'm actually a us 12. The bra fit nice but the bottoms were a bit lose. It would still for its purpose. I wanted something decent... good job. Might get a different top cos this was extra revealing. Like the bottom.

summary: Hourglass shaped, sz 14-16 normally. I ordered a ...

reviewText: At first I wasn't sure about the sizing. I normally wear a US 14/16 and so I wanted to order the XXXXL which stated was a 14/16 but when I tried to select that option it said that size didn't ship to Colombia. I contacted Amazon and a wonderful customer service rep helped me look for options in my size. The choice that ships to Colombia is really poor and we didn't find anything. In the end I decided to give it a shot and order the XXXL 12/14. It arrived super fast in like 3 days and I was so happy it fit wonderfully! The bottoms were perfect, no struggle to get on the size is perfect for me. The top could be a little bigger because I'm a 40D but it doesn't look shameless hehe. This is the first bikini I have bought in my life because of my body shape I always felt embarrassed of the bulging belly. But after buying this I'm glad I took the risk and even ordered two the blue and red polka dot and the red black polka dot skull bottoms. I love them and I feel super confident about wearing them on the beautiful Caribbean beach this August. So any of you big ladies out there doubting... high waist bikinis are the bomb gals super flattering and super comfy. Material is great, and looks just like the pics!
summary: The 3XL suit is a great fit for a size 14/16 go for it!

So, go bigger if you're unsure of the fit because these run small. ALSO- if you're looking for a suit that will be slimming this is NOT the suit. reviewText:
I'm 5'2", 120 lbs--and I was so excited about this suit--but--it's really rather awkward, and not meant for short women. I ordered two different patterns and had to return both, the blue and red polka dot, and the navy and white.
For the blue and red polka dot: The top fit perfect, I'm a 32 C, but the bottoms came up all the way to my bust. So it really didn't look like a bikini at all. It also pooched too much in the stomach so it didn't hide anything--and actually made my stomach (which I was hoping it would hide) more noticeable. I had high hopes for this one--but just didn't fit.
For the navy and white polka dot: Despite the fact that I ordered the exact same size in both suits, this one had the exact opposite problem! The bottoms fit perfectly--sat right above my belly button, but the cups of the top are made for a much larger chest. It was almost comical how much larger the top was. It basically dwarfed by chest and looked really, really awkward.

So, overall--super cute, but move on if you're short or smaller chested.
Like fitting

I ended up in an XL, which fits comfortably on the bottom, but snug on the top. I am considering even buying an additional one in a regular large, but am afraid the top will then be too small. I probably could pin it together, but I don't know if that would be for style only, and not functionality. Yes, I want to look cute, but I also want to swim! Ha.

This review is going to be rather lengthy, so if you feel prepared, then read on!
I was very wary of buying this swimsuit because of the differing reviews regarding size. However, I will go into detail about the sizing and how it fits me. For reference, I am 19-years-old. I wear a 38C bra, I'm 150 pounds, and my measurements are 38-29-40. My hips are very large and my waist is on the smaller side. If I had to label my body, I would say that I'm pear-shaped. I usually wear a size 10 dress.
When I saw that I would need to order an XL, I was like "No way!" I've never worn/bought ANYTHING extra large in my entire life, even now when I'm at my heaviest. But I'm glad I did. If I would have ordered a large, the bottoms wouldn't have fit over my large hips. The top, however, doesn't look as shown in the picture. The cups are about an inch apart. I don't know how to work a sewing machine so I'm just going to have to deal with it, but if you do know how to work one, it wouldn't take much effort to sew the cups closer together. I also heard a few of the seams popping as I pulled the bottoms off, but when I pulled them back up to check, nothing had come loose or unraveled.
I ordered the navy suit with red polka-dots. In the picture, it looks like a lighter blue but in reality it's almost black, which I actually like better. In summation, I would definitely go based off of the size chart and not what you normally wear, because these sizes do run different from normal bathing suits. I'll update this review later if I run into any problems with the swimsuit later on. Thanks for reading. :)
summary: CocoShip NavyBlue Vintage High Waisted Bikini Swimsuits Swimwear XL (FBA)

reviewText: Just what I wanted for my trip!
Very nice shirt.

The label says wash in cold water (I don't think this is mentioned in the online information). Of course, the shirt is 100 percent cotton, so it will probably shrink if washed in warm or hot, even though it claims to be pre-shrunk (so why the requirement to wash in cold?). I would put this closer to a medium than the large I ordered (I'm 5'  8" and not overweight).

The collar is much wider than the picture would lead you to believe, sort of geeky looking.

The material is thin, which I like, as it will help keep me cool in my humid climate, the main reason I bought the shirt in first place. While the front panels at the buttons do not match (which I knew before buying), the pocket is matched to the surrounding area.

Overall it's an okay shirt for around $22; I gave it three stars because one of the buttons was nearly falling off when the shirt arrived. I had to sew it back on to prevent losing it on the first wearing.

**EDIT** I'm changing my review to one star. After washing, this shirt is misshapen and hardly wearable. I'm returning it. Also, I bought another shirt from this same manufacturer and a button fell off of it after 10 minutes of wearingsame problem I had with this shirt.

Stay away from Palm Wave shirts.

reviewText: Great costume for the price! Was perfect for my sons Davy Crockett presentation at school. Saved me from making a costume and fit him great!!

HALLOWEEN 2016: This is a pretty good Halloween costume for the price. I read the other reviews and was worried about the costume sizing and the size of the coon skin hat. Luckily as of September 2016 the manufacturer has fixed these issues.

 Costume Fabric 

The fabric is a Polyester faux suede. For lack of a better way to describe it, the material is like a thin shammy-type microfiber towel. You know, the ones you drape around your neck that everyone has. It reminds me of that material but it is only suede-like on one side. It is too thin for warmth but too thick to truly breathe properly. We live in Houston and my son started feeling too hot in it during 80 degree weather but it is also too lightweight to provide warmth if it is cold. Plan on layering something under this if you have to trick or treat in anything colder than 65F. The fringe is even thinner and lighter weight but it does look cute. It is prone to wrinkling and crumpling a bit more but nothing a bit of steam can't fix.

 Sizing 

The Large size 12-14 costume fit my son who is 4 foot 10, 74 pounds, tall, skinny and wears Boys size 12 at TCP and other popular kid's clothing stores. The pants were long enough to cover his long legs. It might be a stretch if he was a tall size 14 but the costume will for sure fit boy's size 12 and 12 tall. The waist is fully elastic and fit his very thin frame just fine but it would slip off easily if tugged, meaning there is enough room in the elastic waist for various body types.

 The Hat 

I was very pleased that the coon skin hat that came with the costume looks exactly like the example image and it actually fit my 9 year old! (What a relief because he wanted to be Davy Crockett for Halloween and you HAVE to have the coon skin cap!)  His head is 21.5 inches (youth medium-large size in hats) and it fit him perfectly. I would guess the hat to be a youth large or an adult extra-small. The hats that come with the smaller sized costumes may not fit as well. The hat is a faux fur with a thin nylon lining inside and the tail is also faux fur but stuffed (like a stuffed animal) to give it some dimension and fluffy bulk.

 No Additional Accessories 

The bloody axe is not included. The costume shirt is as baggy as shown so you may want to add a brown leather belt, which would be easy to hang a glow stick or flashlight from since dark colored costumes make it so hard to spot children on Halloween night. No other accessories come with the costume except for the hat.

I hope my review helps you to get the perfect size costume for your little adventurer! Happy Trick or Treating!
summary: Halloween 2016  Size LARGE 12-14 fits like Boy's Size 12  Coon Skin Hat Fits Youth Heads 21.5 inches

reviewText: really nice size and colors.

These scarves are great! I can't wait to buy more of these to add to my hair accessories collection!

I have a lot of very thick and curly hair. A lot of headbands aren't thick or strong enough to hold back my hair. As my hair has gotten longer and thicker (as well as curlier): I haven't found any good alternatives for holding back my hair.

I decided it was a good time to try out hair scarves! The quantity of scarves for the price seemed like a great deal, so I decided to try it. These scarves were great quality! They were much, much better than I could've imagined!

They're also not heavy, so they won't make my hair or scalp feel hot. They're also soft, so I don't have to worry about damaging my hair with rough materials. They're nice and wide too, so there's an endless amount of styles that you can do with these!

These would also be great for hair wrapping -- either for a style or for religious purposes.

These would be great for fashion purposes too, especially if you were going for a vintage or more posh look since the scarves have a silk-like material.

Overall, this was an excellent purchase! I am most definitely purchasing more of these sometime soon!

reviewText: not only do they look good with everything i pair them with, but they are so comfortable and soft. i would recommend them to everybody. they wash beautifully too.

These aren't the worst leggings ever but they are not at all what I expected from bamboo. Not soft, too thick, no give in the fabric whatsoever so as soon as you stretch out a part (like at the knees) they're no longer fitted and threaten to shimmy down as you walk. Disappointed.

Absolutely perfect.  The material is soft, stretchy, and substantial enough that I don't have underwear lines and it doesn't feel cheap or sheer.  The fit is flattering, and so comfortable you practically forget you're wearing them.  Mine arrived this morning and I already ordered another pair.  I hit the gym almost every day, so I'm almost always in gym clothes, and I can tell I'll be living in these.  My other leggings are Champion brand ones that I paid almost twice as much for, so these are a really outstanding value.

As a point of reference for sizing, I ordered the XS.  I'm 5'0" and 92 lbs and they fit me beautifully.  They bunch a bit around the ankles because they're maybe a tiny bit long, so if you're taller than me (and who isn't?) then I think you'll still be just fine.
summary: Great quality, good fit, super comfortable

reviewText:
I don't own this particular button attacher, but I own one that looks just like it, only mine is red and white. I have owned mine (called One Stitch) for years. I have never used all the fasteners that came with it. Actually, I was given two of the guns with my purchase.

I love it. I never sew on buttons (I hate to sew). When a button falls off, I go grab one of my guns and I usually give the button two fastener shoots and I'm done in under 20 seconds.

Once the plastic fasteners are in place, I don't think I've ever had a button fall off. And yes, it can be used to put price tags back unto items, because the fasteners look just like the plastic fasteners that are used for dangling tags on items.

Does the job look as good as sewing -- no. But, I personally don't care. The biggest downside for me is that sometimes the fasteners can scratch your skin if the shirt where the button is fastened is next to your skin. With me, I often wear a second shirt or T-shirt beneath my blouse, so it's not that big of a problem. Sometimes you can really feel the scratching if you attached a button at the sleeve cuff.

Anyhow, I have had my two button attachers for years. In one gun, I have the black fasteners. In the other gun, I have the white fasteners. They are both always loaded, so all I have to do is get the gun and shoot on the fastener in seconds. I usually give each button two fasteners.

You can't beat this gadget for convenience.
summary: Easy, fast and the fasteners last longer than my clothes do -- I love it (because I hate to sew)!

The Attache' Instant Button Attacher has worked well in attaching buttons to the front and sleeves of casual shirts. The negative is the plastic ends of the fasteners (I used two fasteners/button inserted diagonally) protrude on the inside of the thin shirt fabric and scratch the skin. To overcome this issue, I covered the plastic ends on the inside with a mend and repair pressure sensitive nylon patch that adheres to the shirt fabric (can be purchased at a fabric store or fabric department or online) which I cut into a square. Then, I cut another square slightly larger to place over the first patch to give some thickness. The double patch stopped the scratchy skin problem and also is not visible to the eye. You can also trim the plastic ends on the outside of the buttons with fingernail clippers so that the tips of the fastener ends do not protrude over the button's rim. Thus, with a little ingenuity, it has performed well for my use. I would recommend it to a friend.
summary: I would recommend it to a friend

reviewText: When I first got the item in the mail and opened it, I was bummed. The material seemed kind of "cheap" and I was not sure how much of my underwear I could actually get in the case. To my surprise, not only did I easily get all my underwear for 8 days in the case, but a bra for every day of the week as well as a few other items! It packed so easily, and when I got to the resort, I knew exactly where all my undergarments were. The pockets are kind of small - but they worked. I was pleasantly surprised and would buy another one. I do not think I would buy as a gift, though, unless they had already seen mine. I would want them to "give it a chance" like I did!
Zipper is not working since day 1
I really like this for underwear.

I bought this for a toiletries bag, not for underwear. Good thing, too, because it smells funny. I've left it open to see if it airs out, but I certainly would not want my delicates inside it, absorbing that odor. I sew and I am familiar with the coated ripstop nylon from which it is made, and the odor is not a normal part of that fabric.

The stitching is not good. In one spot the pieces are not seamed together, which means that section will fray and ravel, as anyone who has ever sewn with nylon or acetate can tell you. I can seal the edge with Fray Check, but for $13.99, I shouldn't have to.

The size is not bad, either for underwear or for toiletries, but I'm not sure that the bag will stand up to holding heavy bottles of shampoo, etc. It will do, but I'll make a pattern from it so that I can make my own next time.

This necklace will make a great addition to any outfit that you choose.

This necklace is a true steal for the price. It arrived quickly (3-4 days) and in good condition. It was originally purchased to be part of a costume, but have worn it several times since. BEAUTIFUL deep green color! The stones really do sparkle, and it's so much cheaper than buying statement necklaces at any regular clothing store. I've been reluctant to pay for statement pieces since I'm not always quite sure how to pair them with outfits, but this necklace looks really nice with many of my sweaters and tops. Even though I love this necklace, I do caution those with really sensitive skin because the chain is just regular costume chain and may make you itchy after long wear. Otherwise, this is a great buy and I highly recommend it for people who want a pop of color in their ootd's. :)

reviewText: it is so cute!

I had high hopes for this necklace, despite it's price.  It is attractive, though the way it was put together some of the "hardware" behind the scenes shows.  On the necklace we received, on the right side, the layers are not as close in the picture and you can see the rings that hold it together through the gap.  That being said, the necklace is still attractive and my wife likes it.  For the price I am not terribly surprised, but it would be five stars without the visual appearance resulting from poor construction.

One note, the "leaves" are not all individual, but are connected in rows.  It doesn't move as though they were all separate pieces, if that's something you're looking for.
summary: A good value, but short of a five star quality
